qas.question: How many hamaynkner does Armenia have?
How many districts does Yerevan have?
Does Armenia have more rural or uban hamaynker?
What is the Armenian term for settlment?

context: Within each province are communities (hamaynkner, singular hamaynk). Each community is self-governing and consists of one or more settlements (bnakavayrer, singular <a3_0>bnakavayr<a3_0/>). Settlements are classified as either towns (kaghakner, singular kaghak) or villages (gyugher, singular gyugh). As of 2007[update], Armenia includes <a0_0>915<a0_0/> communities, of which 49 are considered urban and 866 are considered <a2_0>rural<a2_0/>. The capital, Yerevan, also has the status of a community. Additionally, Yerevan is divided into <a1_0>twelve<a1_0/> semi-autonomous districts.
